subject: Career
title: Finding Your Unique Value Proposition
description: Learn Finding Your Unique Value Proposition in one minute.

hook.text: There are millions of marketers, engineers, and designers. Why should someone pick you?

buildup.text: Your unique value proposition sits at the intersection of skills, passion, and market need.

discovery.text: It's not about being the best at one thing. It's about a rare combination nobody else has.

twist.text: Scott Adams calls this the 'talent stack' â€” be top 25% in three things, not top 1% in one.

climax.text: Map your skills: what do you do that others find hard, enjoy, and that people pay for?

punchline.text: You don't need to be the best. You need to be the only.

quiz.question: What is Scott Adams' 'talent stack' concept?
options: Be top 25% in multiple skills instead of top 1% in one
